body: Correct, they do not seem to be related to consistency issues. I think hudi timeline might give some pointers to what is going on here.

I started processing using S3 and am waiting for errors to occur. I am thinking of migrating EMR to version 5.30.0 which is with version 0.5.2 of Hudi.
Do you suggest we continue to evaluate the errors that occurred in version 0.5.0 or do I upgrade from version to 0.5.2?
Today, my production process is running smoothly with HDFS. But I want to use S3 again.
Guys, thanks for attention so far.
@bobgalvao :Can you start with 0.5.2  on S3 and see if you can repro the error. We haven't seen this error before and it is always good to use 0.5.2 as it has general bug fixes
@prashantwason : As this is a large PR, can you @ me once you addressed/replied to all the comments and resolved conflicts :) Helps me in planning the review :)
Also, if you think it is no longer a WIP, you can remove the [WIP] tag from the subject.

@bvaradar:
Perfect, I will start migrating to version 0.5.2 and signal you if an error occurs.
Doubt: is it mandatory to use EMRFS when using Hudi with S3?
Thank you.
can you try changing the level to `com.uber.hoodie=WARN` in etc/log.properties  and check again ?
does info logging cause issue?
@nsivabalan : FYI : I changed the commit message to [MINOR]....
@vinothchandar @bvaradar : Updated the release docs.

Made some changes to the writer options. ``` .option("hoodie.logfile.max.size","256MB") \ .option("hoodie.logfile.to.parquet.compression.ratio","0.5") \ ``` Now the stage looks like this. Time taken on the 3rd task of this stage is the most time consuming part of the processing. (~90%). Not sure what the 3rd task is doing. @vinothchandar
![Screen Shot 2020-06-16 at 5 39 15 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/513218/84831264-0a22ed00-aff9-11ea-80c5-e6fcc031c3a0.png)
@bvaradar Can you take a look at this PR.
@yanghua please take a look when free :)

@nsivabalan : Can you look into this when you get a chance ?

Hudi gives a programmable interface for this. You can plugin your own payload class (subclass of HoodieRecordPayload) where you can implement custom merge logic. For example : org.apache.hudi.common.model.OverwriteWithLatestAvroPayload is the default one  which always picks the latest record.

We have not seen this issue before and hence suspecting some external process is deleting it. 

Is it possible an empty directory is automatically getting removed automatically.  I am wondering if this is the first time archiving is kicking in and finding that an empty .archived folder is deleted.

Thanks @bvaradar for the reply.
how do i plugin my own payload class?

Any examples that i can refer to?

Sorry if i sound too novice.
@harishchanderramesh : You can create a jar with just your payload class implementation and include it in spark-submit command
@leesf : Had rebase, please review again when free.
@yanghua : Had address them, please review again when free.
I will let both of you work it out @prashantwason , @bvaradar
This PR was discussed during the weekly meeting. cc: @xushiyan @vinothchandar

1. in TimestampBasedKeyGenerator#getKey method, generate a HoodieKey will create  a new SimpleDateFormat Object,the dateformat object can be reused as Class variable
2. SimpleDateFormat is not thread safe,there is always potential thread safe problem
@garyli1019 thanks for the diligent follow up! how is this going to be linked on the site? are you planning to add a new entry in the left navigation pane? cc @lamber-ken

@vinothchandar Addressed all your comments. I feel `hudi-test-suite` could be fine, personally find it hard to differentiate between `hudi` and `hudi-system`, not sure if the difference would be obvious to other users. The plan is to setup the nightly performance build by @yanghua and a bunch of follow up items that probably captures the essence of what you have in mind for the `test-suite` instead of `system-test-suite`. If you feel strongly, let me know, I'll change the name.
@yui2010 Thanks for your contributing, would you please check the travis error?

Looks like missing the navigation here https://github.com/apache/hudi/blob/asf-site/docs/_data/navigation.yml#L29
Will add this soon
please add john@viaduct.ai

FYI: The total travis test time has increased by 5 min which seem to be the time for newly added functional test suite.  I dont know enough about surefire so cannot verify but it seems the functional tests are also being executed as part of the unit tests?

![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58448203/85085829-d6c59700-b18d-11ea-94d2-4c7da5605aea.png)
![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58448203/85085831-d927f100-b18d-11ea-91c7-ec892029979c.png)

> FYI: The total travis test time has increased by 5 min which seem to be the time for newly added functional test suite. I dont know enough about surefire so cannot verify but it seems the functional tests are also being executed as part of the unit tests?

Thank you for checking @prashantwason ! The overall test time fluctuates with a few min difference. I would pay attention to the module test time printed at the end of the tests.

The last 2 success runs ended up with ~9 min for `hudi-utilities`

```
[INFO] hudi-utilities_2.11 ................................ SUCCESS [09:13 min]
[INFO] hudi-utilities_2.11 ................................ SUCCESS [09:07 min]
```

 The [last master build](https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/hudi/jobs/699696974) used almost 11 min for `hudi-utilities`

```
[INFO] hudi-utilities_2.11 ................................ SUCCESS [10:50 min]
```

Also did a text search from the travis logs that the tests included in the functional suite are not found, so they are excluded. By separating a few tests to the functional suite, we started to save time from unit tests execution. Incrementally we'll save more. :) 

cc @n3nash @vinothchandar
@yui2010  checkstyle issue, you can setup your IDE with style files from here : https://hudi.apache.org/contributing#ide-setup

@vinothchandar Sure, I searched through the wiki (cwiki.apache.org) and the git repo and don't see where the page https://hudi.apache.org/docs/writing_data.html text contents are pulled from. Where can I add this?
Awesome. Thanks for confirming Raymond.
looks like extending the ComplexKeyGenerator and specifying EMPTY STRING as partition path is a solution.

![Screen Shot 2020-06-18 at 9 04 22 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2701446/85095803-5449d100-b1a7-11ea-9ed4-b70b253d541f.png)

Looks good! Also on the Chinese version.

Sorry for the delay. Was spending time on another large review.

Can we make those changes in this pr itself? Would love to see end-end functionality working. IIRC your ultimate goal is to plug in alliyun metastore?

@bobgalvao  nope it’s not . If you  are using s3, please consider turning on consistency checks
https://hudi.apache.org/docs/configurations.html#withConsistencyCheckEnabled

I assume that’s the final write stage? That’s a large skew. My guess is that’s the insert partition. Can you paste driver logs from a single run? We will be interested in how the MergeOnReadUpsertPartitioner is dividing up the writes 

You can also turn on the hudi metrics to see how each of your commits are writing data.

Also if this the main issue you see as of now? (Meaning others are resolved?). Hudi tries to pack records into fewer Files as possible (small files hurt query performance a lot). So if your goal here is to get this down to much smaller batches, at the cost of smaller files, we may also want to consider trade offs. If you help me understand your high level use case better, it will help me suggest the right thing accordingly
Just finished reviewing bootstrap pr which blocks udits pr :). Will read up and review both your and udits or shortly

[spark-2020-06-18-20-47-55.txt](https://github.com/apache/hudi/files/4802488/spark-2020-06-18-20-47-55.txt)

Have attached driver logs for your review.

1. How do I  turn on the hudi metrics? and how to check each commits are writing data?
2. High level use case is, I would want to write kafka streaming data to an apache hudi table is s3 using pyspark streaming.
1. Batch time should be 1 min and processing time should be around 20 seconds.
2. Data in each batch varies time to time from 4000 records to 100k records on peak times.
3. I am not worried about the memory allocation. I need the processing to be as fast as possible.
4. While merging to hudi table, i would need to ignore updates on columns that get null value from source.
@prashanthpdesai this is something we don’t typically hear about. Did you write to that table at any point using non global bloom and later switch?
Could you check the spark UI and confirm that you have HoodieGlobalBloomIndex show up instead of HoodieBloomIndex?
@nsivabalan i don’t recall fixing anything around this in 0.5.2. Was there a reason why you suggested that?
Will merge after ci passes

> Sorry for the delay. Was spending time on another large review.
> 
> Can we make those changes in this pr itself? Would love to see end-end functionality working. IIRC your ultimate goal is to plug in alliyun metastore?

ok , then i add the changes in this pr. aliyun metastore can plug is valuable for users.Now  users already use kafka -> spark -> hudi + aliyun metastore ->  presto + spark program.

Hey vinoth,

1 - Could you please some shed of light on statement "old behavior for real production use-cases"?
2 - Yes Indexing is dominating, not sure why exactly it is, but it is after setting parameter hoodie.parquet.small.file.limit = 0

> > Understand the issue originates from `MetricRegistry` not allowing update value for existing metric. By the class design, it does enforce the immutable nature of it. A clean impl. could be to update `Gauge<T>` itself. I see `MetricsSource<T>` is wrapping the update logic to serve a similar purpose, which is fine.
> > After some searching, I found that there is a recent upstream PR to implement the "settable" version of `Gauge`
> > [dropwizard/metrics#1599](https://github.com/dropwizard/metrics/pull/1599)
> > which seems to solve the problem right away.
> > IMO we should wait for the upstream change and make small adjustment by using the `SettableGauge`. WDYT?
> 
> I feel ok, but I’m not sure when it will be resolved.

Would you please verify it in deltastreamer continous mode? @shenh062326  I think we would fix it in hudi opensource if the PR https://github.com/dropwizard/metrics/pull/1607 would not get released in next few days. cc @xushiyan

Hi @vinothchandar @nsivabalan : Thank you for checking , No we didn't write table anytime using Bloom index , we wrote as Global Bloom from Beginning . 
Please find the attached spark UI , which is using Global bloom. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60724849/85145630-762c6d80-b212-11ea-9430-5a360ff4f008.png)


as mentioned in the above thread , the data is partitioned on modified_dt we expect to delete the record key present in the older partition (2020-06-15) .
Hi @yanghua, I have addressed all your concerns, PTAL when you get a chance.
@vinothchandar This may be merged. :)
@vinothchandar Is this good to merge? :)
yes sir.. on it..

> > > Understand the issue originates from `MetricRegistry` not allowing update value for existing metric. By the class design, it does enforce the immutable nature of it. A clean impl. could be to update `Gauge<T>` itself. I see `MetricsSource<T>` is wrapping the update logic to serve a similar purpose, which is fine.
> > > After some searching, I found that there is a recent upstream PR to implement the "settable" version of `Gauge`
> > > [dropwizard/metrics#1599](https://github.com/dropwizard/metrics/pull/1599)
> > > which seems to solve the problem right away.
> > > IMO we should wait for the upstream change and make small adjustment by using the `SettableGauge`. WDYT?
> > 
> > 
> > I feel ok, but I’m not sure when it will be resolved.
> 
> Would you please verify it in deltastreamer continous mode? @shenh062326 I think we would fix it in hudi opensource if the PR [dropwizard/metrics#1607](https://github.com/dropwizard/metrics/pull/1607) would not get released in next few days. cc @xushiyan

Yes if the upstream takes some time, we should go ahead with the fix. In that case, I think it'll be beneficial to mimic the approach in that PR, which looks like a clean solution, and make it a smooth migration/clean-up once upstream change is released.
waiting for codecov results, which are expected to be affected. Will investigate solution after that.

hi @yanghua, thanks for your detailed review, I have addressed all your concerns, PTAL when free.
@bvaradar  I have add all the missing types and fix some bugs.

if you are already deploying your app in a jar, all you need to do is to write the class and specify its name in tthe config. Hope  that helps

Thank you all for the feedbacks..will look into codecov.. closing this for now
@afeldman1 http://hudi.apache.org/contributing#website sorry if this was a bit obscure :) site content lives in a `asf-site` branch
@bhasudha  can you please take a pass

@n3nash  let’s please call this integration test to be consistent with the direction @xushiyan has been pushing towards. Unit, integration, functional are standard test terms industry wide. We have to classify this into one of these. hudi-test-suite is very generic IMO

> The plan is to setup the nightly performance build by @yanghua and a bunch of follow up items that probably captures the essence of what you have in mind for th

As it stands now, is this going to add new tests to our ci?

> > > Understand the issue originates from `MetricRegistry` not allowing update value for existing metric. By the class design, it does enforce the immutable nature of it. A clean impl. could be to update `Gauge<T>` itself. I see `MetricsSource<T>` is wrapping the update logic to serve a similar purpose, which is fine.
> > > After some searching, I found that there is a recent upstream PR to implement the "settable" version of `Gauge`
> > > [dropwizard/metrics#1599](https://github.com/dropwizard/metrics/pull/1599)
> > > which seems to solve the problem right away.
> > > IMO we should wait for the upstream change and make small adjustment by using the `SettableGauge`. WDYT?
> > 
> > 
> > I feel ok, but I’m not sure when it will be resolved.
> 
> Would you please verify it in deltastreamer continous mode? @shenh062326 I think we would fix it in hudi opensource if the PR [dropwizard/metrics#1607](https://github.com/dropwizard/metrics/pull/1607) would not get released in next few days. cc @xushiyan

Agree with you, I will verify it in deltastreamer continous mode.

Looking into the driver logs. In the meantime, 

On 1, https://hudi.apache.org/docs/configurations.html#metrics-configs has some pointers.
On 2, ack
On 3, In general there is a trade-off here as I pointed out. If your workload has inserts, the  we should sufficient parallelism to write all that data into parquet within 20 seconds.. You will have a lot of small files to contend with.. 
On 4, This variance may be ok per se. but we need to provision for peak (or use spark dynamic allocation, tune it to work)
On 5, giving enough memory to keep an input batch in memory, would help with indexing (as you are finding).. I would also suggest modelling that data such that keys have a timestamp/ordered prefix as a way to improve speed, if possible. You can find the Tuning guide useful here. 
On 6, I guess this is a just a filter on your side of the code?

The parallelism should be much higher than the 3 task stage you pasted above? In general, you can grep for partitioner output like that to see how the writing partitioning is decided.

can you please confirm this.

>Now users already use kafka -> spark -> hudi + aliyun metastore -> presto + spark program.

Thanks for letting me know.. Thats great! I am a fan of doing the refactor with a precise goal in mind.. so please feel free to reopen if you feel we need to restructure for something else.. AWS Glue also works with the current abstractions..
@lyogev  can you please paste the spark shell or spark submit command you used  that would reproduce this ?

>2 - Yes Indexing is dominating, not sure why exactly it is, but it is after setting parameter hoodie.parquet.small.file.limit = 0

If you turn off small file handling, you end up writing more files, which means - indexing has to compare ranges/bloom filter across many more files.. This is the same reason why you should consider not doing this for query side as well.. small files will hurt query performance a lot as well.. 

Let's do a reset here and try to design for your use-case? happy to work through this if you can share more aobut your goals here..

> 
> I just opened #1753 to verify the solution for it. I'll address your comments soon after that.

@vinothchandar The solution of report coverage by module works; the CI time is reduced by 12min thanks to the split. Could you please review #1753 and try to merge it first? I'll then rebase this one. Meanwhile, the comments were addressed in 443fd2a, which you could review as well.
I believe @harishchanderramesh is trying to get this work. Once he confirms this can be closed.
@masterlemmi  Will take a look today.

@vinothchandar The module split can be adjusted in later phases where we move more functional tests out of unit test tasks and split modules for functional test jobs. The overall CI time will then depend on integration tests around 27 min. This is a great saving for now at least. :)

Spark 3.0 is a new version ( just release on 2020.6.18... ). It is quite different from 2.0, so that it is not surprising that there are some conflicts. 
At present, it is not recommended to use hudi by spark 3.0

@bvaradar I've tested deltastreamer by hudi in master branch, If I set `hoodie.datasource.hive_sync.use_jdbc=false` and  use hive driver class to create hive table, It will report error `java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/json/JSONEXception` .
I checked spark libs and hudi jars, then I found that hudi just use hive2's jars to syn hive, but `hudi-utilities-bundle` can not contain hive2's dependence libs.
This feature has been taken care of by  https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/1433, closing now.

@cdmikechen  : Long time :) 

Hudi utilities include following hive jars in shaded form 
```                  <include>org.apache.hive:hive-common</include>
                  <include>org.apache.hive:hive-service</include>
                  <include>org.apache.hive:hive-service-rpc</include>
                  <include>org.apache.hive:hive-metastore</include>
                  <include>org.apache.hive:hive-jdbc</include>
```
Can you attach the whole exception you are seeing. We had a compliance reason for not including org.json classes (due to licensing issues).
